page.title: 15THE BADGE FACTORY
page.content: TOYE, KENNING AND SPENCER PRODUCE A LARGE AND ASSORTED RANGE OF PRODUCTS. THESE INCLUDE TROPHIES, BADGES AND CUFFLINKS. CASTING AND ENGRAVING IS ALSO PERFORMED THERE. METALS AND TEXTILES ARE TWO ASPECTS OF THEIR BUSINESS. THE FACTORY WAS ORIGINALLY A STABLE. HORSES BELONGING TO THE N.C.B. WERE KEPT THERE. LATER WHEN HORSES NO LONGER WENT UNDERGROUND IN THE COAL MINES, THE STABLE WAS CONVERTED INTO A TRAINING CENTRE FOR APPRENTICES WISHING TO WORK IN THE COAL MINES. THE TOYE FAMILY HAD COME SEEKING REFUGE IN BRITAIN FROM RELIGIOUS PERSECUTION IN FRANCE IN 1685. TOYE, KENNING AND SPENCER WERE LATER FOUNDED. THE TRAINING CENTRE WAS THEN CONVERTED AND EXTENDED INTO TODAYS FACTORY WHICH EMPLOYS 44 PEOPLE
